intro: Hymenothrix biternata, commonly known as the three-lobed liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a mat-forming plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. The plant has a distinctive thalloid structure with a central axis and lateral lobes, giving it its common name. Its leaves are closely spaced and arranged in a compact rosette pattern. Hymenothrix biternata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
